required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnostic Imaging Strategies for Patients With Stable Chest Pain and Intermediate Risk of Coronary Artery Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnostic Imaging Strategies for Patients With Stable Chest Pain and Intermediate Risk of Coronary Artery Disease: Comparative Effectiveness Research of Existing Technologies) - A Pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial of CT Versus ICA

brief_summary.textblock: The primary hypothesis is that computertomography (CT) is superior to invasive coronary angiography (ICA) concerning the primary endpoint MACE (MACE = major adverse cardiovascular event; defined as at least one of the following: cardiovascular death, nonfatal myocardial infarction, and nonfatal stroke) after a maximum follow-up of 4 years, in other words, that CT will result in a significantly lower rate of MACE. Secondary outcomes include MICE (MICE = minor cardiovascular events), procedural complications, cost-effectiveness, radiation exposure, cross-over to CT or ICA, gender differences, and health-related quality of life.

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary objective of this prospective pragmatic randomised controlled trial (PRCT) in 3546 patients is to evaluate the possible superiority of a CT-based patient management over an ICA-based management strategy in stable chest pain patients with intermediate pretest probability (10-60%) of coronary artery disease. The primary outcome measure is the occurrence of MACE (MACE = major adverse cardiovascular events; defined as at least one of the following: cardiovascular death, nonfatal myocardial infarction, and nonfatal stroke) after a maximum follow-up of 4 years after CT or ICA. Secondary outcomes include health related quality of life, cost-effectiveness, cross-over to ICA/CT. Procedural complications are classified into major and minor. Major procedural complications are a composite end-point and include death, nonfatal stroke, nonfatal myocardial infarction and further complications prolonging hospitalization by at least 24 hrs. Possible procedural complications: Hematoma at the puncture site, secondary bleeding at the puncture site, bradycardia, angina without infarction, allergoid contrast agent reaction, stent migration, hypotension requiring treatment, headache, hyperthyreodism, skin tissue and nerve injuries, extravasate, cardiac arrhythmia, contrast-induced nephropathy (CIN), infections, femoral arterial occlusion (or arterial access vessel) or dissection, new requirement for dialysis, DVT/pulmonary embolism, closure or injury of vessels, injury of the heart (e.g. valve or myocardium), cardiac tamponade, perforation, retroperitoneal bleeding, gastrointestinal bleeding, genital-urinary bleeding, other major bleeding, red blood cell (RBC)/whole blood transfusion,twisting or rupture of the catheter part, other equipment mishaps (e.g. retained foreign body guidewire fracture), development of arterio-venous fistula(s), development of pseudo aneurysm at puncture site, dissection, permanent edema (e.g. due to lymphatic congestion at puncture site), embolisation of central or peripheral vessels due to thromboembolis, acute closure of coronary vessels, stent infection, heart failure, cardiogenic shock, wrong patient or wrong procedure and other.
This study is a European multicentre study conducted at 20 clinical centres in 15 European countries and is methodologically based on the single-centre CAD-Man trial conducted by Charit√© (NCT00844220). The pragmatic approach of the study ensures generating practical and usable outcomes for clinical decision-making according to comparative effectiveness research methodology.
In a preceding pilot study, data for cost-effectiveness analyses and image-quality analyses are collected and methods are defined for implementation in the main PRCT. Also appropriate instruments for health related quality of life are being chosen. DISCHARGE receives funding from the 7th Framework Programme of the European Commission (EC-GA 603266).

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 minute after CT/ICA diagnosis/procedure and during follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Composite endpoint: major adverse cardiovascular event (MACE); defined as at least one of the following: cardiovascular death, nonfatal myocardial infarction, and nonfatal stroke.

secondary_outcome.measure: Likelihood of receiving coronary intervention in different European countries
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 1-year follow-up and final follow-up up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Likelihood of receiving coronary intervention and extent of Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) in dependence of socioeconomic status and the likelihood of receiving further intervention within two months after the initial intervention in different European countries.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of percutaneous coronary intervention and use of intracoronary techniques different European countries
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 1-year follow-up and final follow-up up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Rates of Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) and use of intracoronary techniques such as Fractional Flow Reserve (FFR), Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT), Intravascular Ultrasound (IVUS) within two months after the initial intervention in different European countries.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient management in different European countries
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 1-year follow-up and final follow-up up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Recommended and actually performed management based on Computed Tomographic Angiography (CTA) and Invasive Coronary Angiography (ICA) results in different countries adjusted for the extent of ischemia within two month after the initial test randomised to.

secondary_outcome.measure: Follow-up strategies in different European countries
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 1-year follow-up and final follow-up up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Adherence to follow-up in different countries and according to prevalence of CAD as well as risk factors and socioeconomic status and most likely way of conduct of follow-up data gathering in different countries (phone interviews, letter reply, email).

secondary_outcome.measure: European differences in occurrence and extent of Coronary Artery Disease in regards to city versus rural lifestyle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 1-year follow-up and final follow-up up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: European differences in occurrence and extent of Coronary Artery Disease in regards to city versus rural lifestyle

secondary_outcome.measure: European and local differences in patient consent of sites
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 1-year follow-up and final follow-up up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: European and local differences in patient consent of sites

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison in the Coronary Computed Tomographic Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography group:Occurrence of Minor Adverse Cardiovascular Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the CTA/ICA examination, up to 48h after hours after the final procedure related to the test randomized to, 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of minor adverse cardiovascular events (MICE): coronary revascularisation, peripheral artery revascularisation, hospitalisation for angina pectoris, emergency department visit for angina pectoris, transient ischemic attack, congestive heart failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison in the Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive coronary Angiography group: Percutaneous Coronary Intervention and Coronary Artery Bypass Graft
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the CTA/ICA examination, up to 48h after hours after the final procedure related to the test randomized to, 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Rates of Percutaneous Coronary Intervention and Coronary Artery Bypass Graft (CABG) performed within 2 months following Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography (defined as: related to these tests) and more than 2 months after CTA and ICA until follow-up (unrelated to these tests).

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison in the Computer Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography group: Rates of patients on dialysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the CTA /ICA examination, up to 48h after hours after the final procedure related to the test randomized to, 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison in the CTA and ICA group: Rates of patients on dialysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison in the Computer Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography group: Rate of coronary anatomical anomalies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the CTA /ICA examination, up to 48h after hours after the final procedure related to the test randomized to, 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Rate of coronary artery anomalies (benign and malignant) and rate of myocardial bridging seen on CTA and ICA and the clinical implications of these at follow-up as well as influence on Major Adverse Cardiovascular Events (MACE) and MICE

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison in the computer tomography angiography and invasive coronary angiography group: Rates of patients undergoing further cardiac diagnostics
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Rates of patients undergoing further cardiac diagnostics, such as additional CT or ICA, Electrocardiography (ECG), Exercise ECG, Echo, Stress Echo, Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) within 2 months following CT and invasive coronary angiography (defined as: related to these tests) and more than 2 months after CT and invasive coronary angiography until follow-up (unrelated to these tests).

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison in the computer tomography angiography and invasive coronary angiography group: Rates of coronary interventions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Rates of coronary interventions within 2 months following CT and ICA (defined as: related to these tests) and more than 2 months after CT and ICA until follow-up and recurrent angina leading to hospitalisation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of the influence of prior computer tomography angiography on invasive coronary angiography and percutaneous coronary intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of influence of prior CT on ICA and PCI in terms of duration, radiation exposure, amount of contrast agent used for ICA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of cumulative contrast agent amount in the two arms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of cumulative contrast agent amount in the two arms

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison in the computer tomography angiography and invasive coronary angiography group: Number/proportion of patients undergoing coronary revascularization
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Compared with ICA, CTA will be associated with a lower rate of coronary revascularisation, but on a per-procedure basis, revascularisation will be more complete. Performance of revascularisation will differ between the randomised groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison in the computer tomography angiography and invasive coronary angiography group: Distribution in the mode of revascularization: percutaneous coronary intervention vs. coronary artery bypass graft
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison in the CTA and ICA group: Distribution in the mode of revascularisation: PCI vs. CABG.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of Quality of Life between treatment regimens.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of Quality of Life between the following treatment regimens using adherence to therapy recommendation as covariate: optimal medical therapy in general in combination with risk factor modification vs. oral statin intake in combination with risk factor modification.

secondary_outcome.measure: Geographical distribution of risk factors for Major Cardiovascular Events and Minor Cardiovascular Events and other events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Geographical distribution of risk factors for MACE and MICE, cardiovascular events and cardiac events (cardiac and non-cardiac death, stroke, myocardial infarction, unstable angina pectoris, re-revascularisation and first revascularisation) in the European Union (EU) and comparison of European countries.

secondary_outcome.measure: Extent of Coronary Artery Disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Extent of CAD in dependence of patients' socioeconomic status (income, education, occupation, job situation, gender)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from randomisation to Invasive Coronary Angiography in both groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomisation to Invasive Coronary Angiography in both groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from randomisation to first coronary revascularisation in both groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomisation to first coronary revascularisation in both groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Completeness of revascularisation for Percutaneous Coronary Intervention single vessel vs multivessel Percutaneous Coronary Intervention and Coronary Artery Bypass Graft; stent use (bare metal vs drug eluting)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Completeness of revascularisation (i.e. no. of vessels treated vs. number of vessels affected by > 50% stenosis); for Percutaneous Coronary Intervention single vessel vs multivessel Percutaneous Coronary Intervention and Coronary Artery Bypass Graft; stent use (bare metal vs drug eluting).

secondary_outcome.measure: Information on surgical procedures i.e. isolated Coronary Artery Bypass Graft, Coronary Artery Bypass graft with valve replacement, Coronary Artery Bypass Graft with aortic surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Information on surgical procedures i.e. isolated Coronary Artery Bypass Graft, Coronary Artery Bypass graft with valve replacement, Coronary Artery Bypass Graft with aortic surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison in the Computer Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography group: procedures and outcomes in relation to age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison in the Computer Tomography angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography group: procedures and outcomes in relation to age.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison in the Computer Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography group: procedures and outcomes in relation to body mass index and obesity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison in the Computer Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography group: procedures and outcomes in relation to body mass index and obesity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Reduction of angina pectoris intensity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Reduction of angina pectoris intensity (measured on a 0-10 scale, at baseline, first and final follow up, max 4 years) in the two arms and in the subgroup of a) patients with significant stenosis (on CTA or ICA) and with or without relevant myocardial ischemia that was or was not revascularised by PCI or CABG; b) patients without significant stenosis (on CT or ICA) and with or without non-coronary or non-cardiac finding potentially explaining the chest discomfort; in patients who underwent PCI versus patients who received optimal medical therapy and risk factor modification alone (matched analysis for the extent of CAD and imaging ischemia).

secondary_outcome.measure: Validation of different questionnaires to predict Major and Minor Adverse Cardiac Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Validation of the Rose Angina questionnaire including pain scale and the InterHeart Risk Score (IHRS) to predict MACE and MICE in both arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of adverse events due to medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, up to 48h after hours after the final procedure related to the test randomised to
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Adverse events due to nitroglycerin, beta-blockers, contrast agent and other medication applied during CTA and ICA (allergic reactions, hypotension, headache, hyperthyroidism).

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of adverse events related to venous or arterial puncture
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, up to 48h after hours after the final procedure related to the test randomised to
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Adverse events related to venous or arterial puncture: skin tissue and nerve injuries, bleedings: due to puncture of vessel, due to use of anticoagulants, at site of puncture (hematoma), extravasate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of cardiac arrhythmia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, up to 48h after hours after the final procedure related to the test randomised to
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of cardiac arrhythmia

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of contrast-induced nephropathy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, up to 48h after hours after the final procedure related to the test randomised to
secondary_outcome.description: Rates of contrast-induced nephropathy (CIN) adjusted for the frequency of creatinine follow-up testing performed in the two groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Infections
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, up to 48h after hours after the final procedure related to the test randomised to
secondary_outcome.description: Infections

secondary_outcome.measure: Influence of experience of examiners on events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, up to 48h after hours after the final procedure related to the test randomised to
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of the experience (in years) of the CT and ICA examiner with procedural events, duration of the exams (in min), contrast agent amount (in ml) used for diagnosis and intervention (if done), and exposure of radiation (in mSv).

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of occurrence of procedural complications related to Invasive Coronary Angiography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during ICA examination, up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Comparison of a) outpatient vs inpatient ICA for procedural complication rates after adjusting for risk factors for such events,b) femoral vs radial approach ICA, and c) different closure devices vs. manual compression and of frequency of interventions, results, patients acceptance and d) procedural differences, for instance bed rest time after intervention, and influence on procedural events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Procedural complications related to Invasive Coronary Angiography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during ICA examination, up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Complications related to ICA: Femoral arterial occlusion (or arterial access vessel) or dissection, Cardiac arrhythmia, closure or injury of vessels, injury of the heart (e.g. valve or myocardium) , twisting or rupture of the catheter or parts of the catheter consecutive surgical removal, development of arteria-venous fistulas, development of a pseudo aneurysm at puncture site, permanent edemas, embolisation of central or peripheral vessels due to thromboembolism.

secondary_outcome.measure: Procedural complications during or after revascularisation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during ICA examination, up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Complications during or after revascularisation, for instance acute closure of coronary vessels, angina pectoris, loss of stent and consecutive closure of vessels, stent infection.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of other adverse events and serious adverse events in the Invasive Coronary Angiography group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during ICA examination, up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Occurrence of other adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs) such as heart failure, cardiogenic shock, cerebrovascular accident (CVA)/Stroke, hemorrhagic stroke, new requirement for dialysis, deep vein thrombosis/pulmonary embolism, cardiac tamponade, perforation, retroperitoneal bleeding, gastrointestinal bleeding, genital-urinary bleeding, major bleeding, red blood cell (RBC)/Whole blood transfusion, other equipment mishaps (e.g. retained foreign body guidewire fracture), wrong patient or wrong procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of incidental findings in Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography group and potential benefits and harms of findings Analysis of prevalence non-coronary cardiac and non-cardiac causes of symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during CTA and ICA examination, up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of prevalence of a) non-coronary cardiac causes of symptoms (such as aortic dissection, valve disease, pericarditis) or b) non-cardiac causes of symptoms (such as thrombus, pulmonary embolism, pleural effusion, pneumonia, hiatal hernia).

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of incidental findings in both arms and potential benefits and harms of findings:Influence of non-coronary cardiac and non-cardiac findings on Major Adverse Cardiac Events, non-cardiac events and Quality of Life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during CTA and ICA examination, up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Influence of non-coronary cardiac and non-cardiac findings on MACE, non-cardiac events and Quality of Life (QoL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of incidental findings in Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography group and potential benefits and harms of findings: Rate for malignancy in nodules seen on Computed Tomography Angiography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during CTA and ICA examination, up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Rate for malignancy in nodules seen on CT (reference standard: biopsy results, Positron Emission Tomography (PET) findings, or progression versus no change or regression on follow-up CT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of incidental findings in Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography group and potential benefits and harms of findings
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during CTA and ICA examination, up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Accuracy of the parsimonious lung cancer risk prediction tool by McWilliams et al. for probability assessment of malignancy in lung nodules found in comparison to the above combined reference standard

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of incidental findings in Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography group and potential benefits and harms of findings: Rate of death from cancer in both groups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of death from cancer in both groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of incidental findings in Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography group and potential benefits and harms of findings:Rates of unnecessary follow-up procedures
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Rates of unnecessary follow-up procedures such as examinations, biopsies, or surgeries done based on non-coronary findings in the CTA and ICA group

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of interobserver variability (site versus core lab)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of interobserver variability (site vs. core lab) of reading for coronary stenosis and plaques on CTA and for coronary stenosis on ICA

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent diameter stenosis correlation and agreement by both diagnostic tests in patients who underwent Invasive Coronary Angiography in the Computed Tomography Angiography group after positive or non-diagnostic findings
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Percent diameter stenosis correlation and agreement by Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography in patients who underwent Invasive Coronary Angiography in the Computed Tomography Angiography group after positive or non-diagnostic findings.

secondary_outcome.measure: Non-diagnostic Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Non-diagnostic CTA and ICA: comparison of prevalence and patient as well as technical factors leading to such uninterpretable findings or exams that could not be conducted or completed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between percent diameter stenosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between percent diameter stenosis by Computed Tomography with invasive Fractional Flow Reserve in patients who had Computed Tomography and Invasive Coronary Angiography done and correlation of non-invasively estimated Fractional Flow Reserve by Computed Tomography with invasive Fractional Flow Reserve after Computed Tomography/Invasive Coronary Angiography.

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of sinus node artery being a side branch of Left Coronary Artery or Right Coronary Artery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Prevalence of sinus node artery being a side branch of Left Coronary Artery (LCX) or Right Coronary Artery RCA by core lab reading and the risk of CAD on CT and ICA as well as MICE and MACE.

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of left, intermediate, and right coronary distribution type
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Prevalence of left, intermediate, and right coronary distribution type by core lab and site reading and the risk of CAD (as significant) on CT and ICA at baseline and MICE and MACE.

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement of selection of distal coronary segments used for CABG-anastomosis by CT in comparison to ICA alone (especially heavy calcification detection) as assessed by the cardiac surgeons.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement of selection of distal coronary segments used for Coronary Artery Bypass Surgery-anastomosis by Computed Tomography in comparison to Invasive Coronary Angiography alone (especially heavy calcification detection) as assessed by the cardiac surgeons.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relation of plaque characterisation and quantification by core lab and Major and Minor Adverse Cardiac Events at the two follow-up results
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Relation of plaque characterisation and quantification by core lab and MACE and MICE at the two follow-up results.

secondary_outcome.measure: Image quality of Computed Tomography by core lab read and flow and concentration of contrast agent used intravenously
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Computed Tomography examination and up to 6 months after the Pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial
secondary_outcome.description: Image quality of CT by core lab read and flow and concentration of contrast agent used intravenously

secondary_outcome.measure: Coronary artery dimensions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Computed Tomography examination and up to 6 months after the Pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial
secondary_outcome.description: Coronary artery dimensions in patients in whom contraindications prevented the use of nitroglycerin for CTA versus patients who received nitroglycerin (measured as the diameter of the Left Marginal Artery (LMA), proximal Left Anterior descending artery (LAD), LCX and RCA), adjusted for gender and Body Surface Area (BSA).

secondary_outcome.measure: Noise in Computed Tomography Angiography imaging
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Computed Tomography examination and up to 6 months after the Pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial
secondary_outcome.description: Noise in CTA imaging and the factors it depends on for instance adherence vs non-adherence to scan protocol.

secondary_outcome.measure: Factors that influence the image quality of Computed Tomography Angiography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Computed Tomography examination and up to 6 months after the Pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial
secondary_outcome.description: Factors that influence the image quality of CTA ( Body Mass Index (BMI), gender, origin of patient, 80, 100, 120, 135, 140 kV, different mA settings, number of detector rows, heart rate (maximum, minimum, and average during CT acquisition), and acquisition type.

secondary_outcome.measure: Accuracy and agreement of RCADIA system
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Computed Tomography examination and up to 6 months after the Pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial

secondary_outcome.measure: 10-step Guide to cardiac CT
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Computed Tomography examination and up to 6 months after the Pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the 10-step guide to cardiac CT

secondary_outcome.measure: Semi-qualitative analysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Computed Tomography examination and up to 6 months after the Pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: intensity, noise, signal to noise, contrast and signal to noise in some regions of interest (ROIs) (LV, RV segments 1,2,5,6,11 and levocardiography effect).

secondary_outcome.measure: Qualitative analysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Computed Tomography examination and up to 6 months after the Pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: levocardiography effect (scale 1 to 3) and LV, RV and segments 1,2,5,6,11 (scale 1 to 4).

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart rate reduction achieved in Computed Tomography by the DISCHARGE betablocker protocol
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Computed Tomography examination and up to 6 months after the Pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate reduction achieved in Computed Tomography by the DISCHARGE betablocker protocol

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart rate reduction achieved in subgroups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Computed Tomography examination and up to 6 months after the Pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Heart rate reduction achieved in subgroups of patients with contraindication to betablockers or no adherence to protocol where other doses or medications such as ivabradine or calcium channel blockers were used and in different patient groups (e.g., male versus female patients, >65 years and up to 65 years of age).

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart rate reduction achieved with conscious sedation, if used, for Computed Tomography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Computed Tomography examination and up to 6 months after the Pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate reduction achieved with conscious sedation, if used, for CT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of extent of Coronary Artery Disease and a high calcium score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Computed Tomography examination and up to 6 months after the Pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Analysis of prevalence and extent of CAD in correlation to a high calcium score (CS), and exclusion of any CAD in correlation to a zero CS, potential of defining a threshold.

secondary_outcome.measure: Characterisation of plaques
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Computed Tomography examination and up to 6 months after the Pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial
secondary_outcome.description: The characterisation of plaques (type and composition) by CT core lab in relation to cardiac risk factors.

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in plaque characteristics
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Computed Tomography examination and up to 6 months after the Pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Differences in plaque characteristics (type and composition) and analysis of potential influence by geographical origin of the patient, after adjustment for other cardiac risk factors.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of Computed Tomography Angiography and intracoronary techniques
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Computed Tomography examination and up to 6 months after the pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Correlation and agreement for plaque characterisation and quantification by CT in comparison to intracoronary techniques such as OCT and Intravascular ultrasound (IVUS) in patients who had both tests done.

secondary_outcome.measure: Influence of statin treatment on plaque development
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Computed Tomography examination and up to 6 months after the pragmatic Randomised Controlled Trial
secondary_outcome.description: Risk factors for and influence of statin treatment on plaque progression or regression in patients who had follow-up cardiac CT done in the CT group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of effective dose and the diagnostic portion of Invasive Coronary Angiography with weight and body-mass index of the patient.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Invasive Coronary Angiography examination, at 1-year follow-up and at final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of effective dose and the diagnostic portion of Invasive Coronary Angiography with weight and body-mass index of the patient.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of effective dose of and contrast agent amount used for Invasive Coronary Angiography with severity of Coronary Artery Disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Invasive Coronary Angiography examination, at 1-year follow-up and at final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of effective dose of and contrast agent amount used for Invasive Coronary Angiography with severity of Coronary Artery Disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of follow-up Invasive Coronary Angiographies and Percutaneous Coronary Interventions more than 2 months after initial Computed Tomography/Invasive Coronary Angiography and up to first and last follow-up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Invasive Coronary Angiography examination, at 1-year follow-up and at final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of follow-up Invasive Coronary Angiographies and Percutaneous Coronary Interventions more than 2 months after initial Computed Tomography/Invasive Coronary Angiography and up to first and last follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of the number of projections for the right and left coronary artery with effective dose of Invasive Coronary Angiography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Invasive Coronary Angiography examination, at 1-year follow-up and at final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of the number of projections for the right and left coronary artery with effective dose of Invasive Coronary Angiography

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of left ventriculography performed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the Invasive Coronary Angiography examination, at 1-year follow-up and at final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Rates of left ventriculography performed

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of planned cross-over from Computed Tomography to Invasive Coronary Angiography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Rates of planned cross-over from CT to ICA after positive findings in CT within 2 month past initial procedure in accordance to management flow chart.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of cross-over patients (from Computed Tomography to Invasive Coronary Angiography) to non-cross-over-patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of cross-over patients (from Computed Tomography to Invasive Coronary Angiography) to non-cross-over-patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of Computed Tomography Angiography and/or Invasive Coronary Angiography with the results of imaging ischemia tests
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Correlation of CTA and/or ICA results with the results of imaging ischemia tests (stress echo, stress Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography (SPECT), stress Positron Emission Tomography (PET), MRI & stress MRI).

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between imaging ischemia tests and invasive Fractional Flow Reserve if done
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between imaging ischemia tests and invasive Fractional Flow Reserve if done.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of imaging ischemia tests recommended
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Rates of imaging ischemia tests recommended

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of diagnostic accuracy of imaging ischemia tests
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of diagnostic accuracy of imaging ischemia tests (stress echocardiography, SPECT, stress MRI, and PET) for the detection of CTA- or ICA-defined CAD (up to 48h after final procedure related to the randomised test).

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of imaging ischemia results with Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography results for prediction of Major and Minor Cardiac Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of imaging ischemia results with Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography results for prediction of Major and Minor Cardiac Adverse Events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between imaging ischemia results and coronary stenosis as well as plaque composition and characterisation findings by Computed Tomography Angiography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised to, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between imaging ischemia results and coronary stenosis as well as plaque composition and characterisation findings by Computed Tomography Angiography.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of revascularisations recommended and performed after Computed Tomography Angiography and positive or negative imaging ischemia tests in comparison to Invasive Coronary Angiography arm within two month after the initial test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: 13.2.1 Rate of PCI / CABG recommended and performed after CTA and positive or negative imaging ischemia tests in comparison to the ICA arm within two month after the initial test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of the results of study- Computed Tomography Angiography, recommended imaging ischemia test and Invasive Coronary Angiography in patients with respective study course
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of the results of study- CTA, recommended imaging ischemia test and ICA in patients with respective study course

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of procedural events in imaging ischemia testing
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of procedural events in imaging ischemia testing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of intensity and reduction of angina pectoris
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of intensity and reduction of Angina Pectoris (measured on a 0-10 scale, baseline, first and final follow up, max 4 years) with positive, unequivocal, and negative imaging ischemia test results in patients in both study arms; sub-study in patients with imaging ischemia follow-up examinations with an analysis of the correlation between changes in angina intensity and ischemia extent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of patient acceptance ("preference questionnaire") of Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, up to 48h after hours after the final procedure related to the test randomized to, 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of patient acceptance ("preference questionnaire") of CTA and ICA (and in those patients, who received both, which one was the preferred) as well as in the following subgroups: gender, patients without significant stenosis seen on the initial test randomised to, patients with significant stenosis seen on CTA and a) ICA not recommended or done e.g., because of imaging ischemia results or b) ICA done.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient acceptance of informed consent, preparation and procedural aspects of the test performed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, up to 48h after hours after the final procedure related to the test randomized to, 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Patient acceptance of informed consent, preparation, procedural aspects of the tests performed including an assessment of maximum pain during procedures measured using a pain scale and patient acceptance of the management recommendations in the two groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effective radiation dose for Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised, at 1-year follow-up and final follow up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Effective radiation dose (measures as dose length product and dose area product during CT [for coronary artery calcium score (CACS) and CTA] and ICA, respectively) used for CT and ICA and cumulative radiation dose in the two arms at different time points.

secondary_outcome.measure: Reduction of radiation exposure by using coronary artery calcium score information
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 48h after the final procedure related to the test randomised, at 1-year follow-up and final follow up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Reduction of radiation exposure by using CACS information about the coronary artery position along the Z-axis to reduce the Z-axis coverage of the subsequent CTA according to the 10 Steps Guide to Success in Cardiac CT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of radiation dose in Invasive Coronary Angiography and Computed Tomography Angiography: pilot study versus non-study patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography Examination
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of radiation dose in ICA and CT: pilot study versus non-study patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Validation of the coronary artery disease DISCHARGE and COME-CCT pre-test probability calculators
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Validation of the coronary artery disease DISCHARGE and COME-CCT pre-test probability calculators and comparison with other calculators (Diamond and Forrester, DiCAD, Duke clinical score) versus the reference standards (CTA or ICA) in the pilot study of DISCHARGE and the randomised trial.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the ability of the DISCHARGE and COME-CCT pre-test probability calculators to predict Coronary Artery Disease indifferent genders
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the ability of the DISCHARGE and COME-CCT pre-test probability calculators to predict CAD in men and women equally well in comparison to previous calculators.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ability of the DISCHARGE and COME-CCT pre-test probability calculators to predict Coronary Artery Disease
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Ability of the DISCHARGE and COME-CCT pre-test probability calculators to predict CAD in patients without or with coronary artery calcium on CT using CTA or ICA as the reference standard in comparison to previous calculators.

secondary_outcome.measure: Potential advantage of the DISCHARGE and COME-CCT calculators
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Potential advantage of the DISCHARGE and COME-CCT calculators in combination with the NIH chest discomfort guidelines to triage patients most effectively based on pretest probability in comparison to the DISCHARGE approach of CT including calcium scoring and CTA for management decision making about risk factor modification and revascularisation, respectively.

secondary_outcome.measure: Predictive value of the DISCHARGE calculator in patients who could not be included in the trial due to their very low pre-test probability (<10%)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Predictive value of the DISCHARGE calculator in patients with a very low pre-test probability (<10%) who could not be randomised but were sent with an indication for ICA that these patients, who are in a screening log of the study, actually have no CAD on ICA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Predictive value of the DISCHARGE calculator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Predictive value of the DISCHARGE calculator in patients with a high pre-test probability (>60%) who could not be randomised but were sent with an indication for ICA that these patients, who are in a screening log of the study, actually have a high risk of CAD on subsequent ICA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Development and validation of a novel pre-test probability calculator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Development and validation of a novel pre-test probability calculator based on age, gender, symptoms, and cardiac risk factors and/or exercise ECG or imaging ischemia results of patients in DISCHARGE with CT and/or ICA results being the reference standard for the definition of CAD for this novel calculator; comparison of this novel calculator with the simple DISCHARGE pre-test probability calculator.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ability of the DISCHARGE and COME-CCT calculators to predict Major and Minor Adverse Cardiac Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a maximum of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Ability of the DISCHARGE and COME-CCT (Collaborative Meta-analysis in Cardiac CT) calculators (used in the study and developed based on the study results) to predict MACE and MICE at both follow-up will be analysed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cost-Effectiveness Analysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: In addition to the costs of CTA and ICA, we assess costs induced by complications caused by these diagnostic procedures. Those costs split up into costs for additional diagnostics and additional treatments necessary due to the occurrence of major cardiovascular adverse events. Therefore, number, type and severity of adverse events, caused by CTA and ICA will be evaluated as well as the type of treatment and if the treatment is conducted in an ambulant setting or requires hospitalisation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cost-Utility Analysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the costs of an additional quality adjusted life year (QALY) gained by a correct diagnosis gained by using CTA or ICA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of cost-effectiveness analysis and cost-utility analysis in different European countries
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: All analyses including costs will be conducted separately for each country with a study center to enable us to conduct comparative analyses on an international level.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average days off work per patient by clinical site during follow up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events might lead to sick leave in patients, which is an important cost factor from the societal perspective. There will be an assessment of differences in sick leave in patients by clinical site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Days in hospital per patient by clinical site during follow up
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events might lead to hospitalisation in patients. In addition to days off work, this is an important cost factor from the societal perspective. There will be an assessment of differences in hospitalisation in patients by clinical site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Additional diagnostic tests during follow-up by clinical site
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in adverse events might lead to a different use of diagnostic tests during the follow-up phase. Therefore, data about cost-effective differences in examinations, not being mandatory according to the study protocol, will be collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Additional treatments during follow-up by clinical site
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in adverse events might lead to a different necessity of treatments during the follow-up phase. Therefore, data about cost-effective differences in treatments, not mandatory by study protocol, will be collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pragmatic assessment of staff involvement time and material use - completion of questionnaires
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to a maximum of 2 years after completion of pilot study at all sites
secondary_outcome.description: A pragmatic Case Report Form (CRF) for the assessment of staff involvement time and use of material was developed for the pilot study. The completion of questionnaires in different clinical sites will be assessed to evaluate this approach.

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in staff involvement time for Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography in different clinical sites
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to a maximum of 2 years after completion of pilot study at all sites
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in staff involvement time in different clinical sites will be assessed. Staff involvement time is one of the major cost drivers in health care systems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in consumption of materials in different clinical sites
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to a maximum of 2 years after completion of pilot study at all sites
secondary_outcome.description: Different consumption of materials in different clinical sites will be assessed. Therefore we will use standardised prices for inter-site comparisons.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of population of pilot study between the different European clinical sites
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to a maximum of 2 years after completion of pilot study at all sites
secondary_outcome.description: The pilot study is not a prospective randomised trial. Inclusion of patients with a pretest-likelihood greater than 60% was allowed due to retrospective calculation of pretest likelihood. Thus, the population in the pilot study differs from the population being included in the DISCHARGE main trial. As cost-effectiveness data will be calculated using data from the pilot study, controlling for age, gender, pretest-likelihood, and quality of live related parameters and others is essential. The prevalence of coronary artery disease will be assessed by site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of previous cardiac examination results of patients included in the pilot study with result of Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to a maximum of 2 years after completion of pilot study at all sites
secondary_outcome.description: Previous cardiac examination results will be assessed in the pilot study, reflecting the routinely performed tests before referral to Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography. The correlation of these previous tests with the CTA or ICA results will be analysed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of hospitalisation after Invasive Coronary Angiography in different European clinical sites
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to a maximum of 2 years after completion of pilot study at all sites
secondary_outcome.description: Due to differences in clinical practice and recommendations throughout Europe, patients may be hospitalized after Invasive Coronary Angiography. Analysis will be conducted to assess this cost factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of non-diagnostic segments in Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography in the pilot study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to a maximum of 2 years after completion of pilot study at all sites
secondary_outcome.description: Non-diagnostic segments can occur in Computed Tomography Angiography and Invasive Coronary Angiography. This might lead to subsequent examinations, thus indicating an important cost factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of major cardiovascular adverse events in the pilot study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to a maximum of 2 years after completion of pilot study at all sites
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of major cardiovascular adverse events within 48 hours after examination will be analyzed. As major cardiovascular adverse events may lead to subsequent examinations they represent a major cost factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health related Quality of Life and Lifestyle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Group (CTA vs ICA) differences in health-related QoL instruments (SF-12 self-rated health item, SF-12 physical component summary score, EuroQol 5d-3L and Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale). Hypothesis: There will be no group differences in QoL at 1 year and final follow-up. We will analyse sociodemographic, lifestyle and clinical predictors of changes in QoL (SF-12 physical component and VAS) between baseline and 1 year / final follow-up, separately for men and women. Important clinical predictors include significant CAD findings during the course of the study, changes in chest pain severity (Angina class), occurrence of MICE / MACE as well as baseline risk factor status (BMI, diabetes, smoking, physical inactivity, excessive alcohol intake).

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptance of time trade-off question in the pilot study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Acceptance of time trade-off question in the pilot study

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the health instruments
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the QoL questionnaires used in the pilot and in the main study (SF-12, EuroQoL 5d-3L, Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, and the MacNew).

secondary_outcome.measure: Gender differences regarding all aspects of medical history
secondary_outcome.time_frame: : at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Gender differences regarding all aspects of medical history will be collected at randomization and follow-up. Data will be analysed in regards to occurrence of MACE and MICE in all genders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gender differences in radiation exposure and gender
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in radiation exposure and gender.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gender differences regarding Quality of Life, lifestyle and socioeconomic status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Differences regarding QoL, lifestyle and socioeconomic status at baseline as well as in regards to changes of these factors seen at the two follow-up time points in the two randomised groups and in male and female patients with and without CAD on testing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gender differences in examination results
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of the examination results (rate of coronary artery disease, PCI rate adjusted for CAD prevalence, occurrence of adverse events, stress tests used, patient acceptance) in all genders.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gender differences of coronary plaque characteristics determined by Computed Tomography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Gender differences of coronary plaque characteristics determined by CT including parameters like coronary plaque assessment, including calcified, mixed and non-calcified plaques, remodeling index, ring-sign, spotty calcification.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gender differences of myocardial resting blood flow / tissue characteristics determined by Computed Tomography Angiography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Gender differences of myocardial resting blood flow / tissue characteristics determined by cardiac CT using parameters such as regional and global TPR, AD, PI, perfusion defects, myocardial calcification, myocardial fatty infiltration, myocardial thinning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic value of Computed Tomography in men vs women - frequency of true positive findings in patients referred for Invasive Coronary Angiography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Diagnostic value of CT in men vs women - frequency of true positive findings in patients referred for ICA - i.e. frequency of revascularization in patients referred for ICA based on CT with and without ischemia testing, CT findings, Ischemia testing findings, ICA findings and revascularization in patients of the CT group referred to ICA as a consequence of index evaluation, radiation dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gender differences of pulmonary findings of Computed Tomography Angiography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Gender differences of pulmonary findings of cardiac CT a) signs of pulmonary congestion: Ground-Glass Opacification (GGO), Pleural effusions, interlobular transudate high density pulmonary attenuation index b) pulmonary emphysema (with/without CAD), low density pulmonary attenuation index c) Pulmonary embolism (major, minor).

secondary_outcome.measure: Gender differences of structural Computed Tomography Angiography findings
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow-up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Gender differences of structural cardiac CT findings including parameters such as LV-mass, volumes and dimensions of Left Ventricle (LV), Left Atrium (LA), Right Ventricle (RV), Right Atrium (RA) and blood pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of occurrence in Major Adverse Cardiac Events in subgroups
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Analysis of occurrence in MACE as a secondary outcome in following subgroups: Angina classification groups CT plaque characteristic groups: high risk versus other plaques versus no plaques Gender: male versus female Age: occurrence of MACE in patient a) under 45 years, b) between 45 and 65 years and c) over 65 years QoL: patients with significant QoL reductions versus patients with no changes in QoL BMI: Patients with BMI a) under 25, b) between 25 and 30 and c) over 30

secondary_outcome.measure: Major Adverse Cardiac Events in different composites
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Composite outcome: Occurrence of MACE in patients with a) circular death or Myocardial Infarction (MI), b) cardiac death or MI.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of Myocardial Infarction and stroke
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, at 1-year follow-up and final follow up to a max of 4 years
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of myocardial infarction and stroke

arm_group.description: Computed Tomography Angiography including coronary calcium scoring and coronary computed tomography angiography

intervention.description: Clinical management/treatment decisions based on cardiac computed tomography including coronary calcium scoring and coronary computed tomography angiography
Clinical management/treatment decisions based on invasive coronary angiography

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with suspected coronary artery disease with stable chest pain and intermediate pretest probability (10-60%) of CAD referred for conventional coronary angiography.
"Stable chest pain" defined as not:
- being acute (= first appearance within the last 48 hours) or
- instable (= a) first appearance with at least Canadian Cardiovascular Society Angina Grading Scale (CCS) Class III, b) progredient with at least 1 CCS Class to at least CCS Class III or, now at rest for at least 20 min) angina pectoris
- Patients at least 30 years of age
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients on hemodialysis
- No sinus rhythm
- Pregnancy
- Any medical condition that leads to the concern that participation is not in the best interest of health (e.g., extensive comorbidities)

facility.name: University College Dublin, National University of Ireland
Universita Degli Studi Di Roma La Sapienza
Paula Stradina Kliniska Universitates Slimnica As
Centro Hospitalar de Vila Nova de Gaia/Espinho Epe
South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust Nhs
Aintree University Hospital Nhs Foundation Trust
